title: How to Create a Simple Program in C++

steps.headline: Get a compiler and/or IDE.
steps.description: Three good choices are GCC, or if your computer is running Windows, Visual Studio Express Edition or Dev-C++.

steps.headline: Try some example programs.
Save this as a .cpp file with a name that accurately reflects your program.
steps.description: Don't confuse there are many other extensions for C++ files, choose any of them (like *.cc, *.cxx, *.c++, *.cp) . Hint: It should say Save as Type: {select "All Files"}

steps.headline: Compile it.
steps.description: For users of linux and gcc compiler, use Command : g++ sum.cpp. Users of Window can use any C++ compiler, such as MS Visual C++,Dev-C++ or any other preferred program.

steps.headline: Run the program.
steps.description: For users of Linux and gcc compiler  Command : ./a.out (a.out is an executable file produce by compiler after compilation of program.)

tyn: A text/code editor (e.g. vim, notepad, etc).
Alternatively, an IDE contains an editor and a compiler.
